Mr. Federico is a merchant. He has a well-stocked store with essential products, run by him and his wife. He also buys and sells coal. Every week, he buys in bulk and repacks in one-kilo bags. Federico’s wife also works hard and he says that she was part of a group composed of women until its eleventh cycle. She had to leave in order to be able to request larger amounts and extend her repayment periods. They have always been hardworking persons, struggling to get ahead and help their family.

This loan is to buy rice, sugar and other products in bulk, with which they will be able to continue offering their clients a wide variety of products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo works hard to earn a living. He is a business oriented person who is married with three children. Rodolfo aims to earn a greater income so his children can finish their studies and he can secure his family's future.

Rodolfo plans to purchase additional kilograms of fish and meat for his food sales business because it's harvest season. With his determination to get ahead in life, he is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. He knows that it will help him realize his goals in life. He just hopes that lenders will continue to support him financially so he can have a comfortable way of life someday and educate his youngest child.

loans.use: to buy fish and meat for sale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old and married with five children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, and spices.

Virginia has previously borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income buying and selling fermented shrimp and fish as well as dried fish.

Virginia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, and spices.

loans.name: Jeannette De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Jeannette  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una institución del estado en el área de informática casada con dos hijos en edad escolar.

Doña Jeannette está solicitando un crédito a kiva ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento piedra arena para hacerles unas mejoras a su casa ya que considera necesario  para darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeannette lives in the city of Managua and works with computers for a governmental institution. She is married and has two children in school.

Mrs. Jeannette is requesting a Kiva-CEPRODEL loan to buy building materials such as cement, rocks and sand for some home improvements needed to give her children a more comfortable space.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: rebuild her working capital and buy fish  for resale  in order to continue making a living.

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en: Enkhtuvshin, 27 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been running a grocery store since 2011 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field. His acumen, charisma and politeness have helped him to stabilize his business by attracting customers even though the store is not located in a good location. In order to generate more income for his family, he wants to increase the circulating capital of his grocery store. So he is requesting a loan of 3,400,000 MNT to purchase foodstuffs in large quantities. As a result, he can continue to run his grocery store without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future. Also during his free time, he renders taxi service to local people using his automobile.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in large quantities

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha, 29, is married with two dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Damabe district. The main source of her family’s income is growing cassava. To supplement that income, Tha's husband also works for others for a fee. Tha and her husband have been running their business for nine years, earning about 34,000 KHR per day. Tha is able to save about 15,000 KHR each day. 

Tha is new to VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group of three to request a loan of 4,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Tha is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income and to send her children in school.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her cassava.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron is 26 and married with three children. Her family lives in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, and she and her husband earn a living through growing cassava and raising pigs. She and her husband work for others for a fee to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her approximately 16 USD per day; she manages to save about 6 USD each day after daily expenses. 

Saron is an existing client of VisionFund who has received previous loans for one cycle. The past loan helped relieve her family's financial burden to a great extent. She is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend planting rubber trees to earn extra income for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow cassava as well as rubber trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Chanthy, 38, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Tbaung Khmum district. She has five children, all of whom are dependents. Some of her children are still in school while others run their own businesses. For the last 18 years, she has earned a living by working in a rubber field where she earns about 30,000 KHR per day. Chanthy leads a two-person loan group and is requesting her third loan from VisionFund. She will use her portion of this loan to support her children's business. She hopes this loan will help her children do well and earn a good income.

loans.use: to support her children’s business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en: Hermie is from the village of Minanga Proper, Angadanan. He runs a transportation business using his motorcycle. He has been in this business for ten years and usually earns about 300 PHP a day. Hermie is 28 years old and still single. He hopes to become a good husband and father for his future family, and that's why he works hard. At this time, Hermie is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy oil, sprockets, and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy oil, sprockets, and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 54 years old and lives in Payatas, Philippines. She is married and a mother, and earns a living by making wallets out of straw. She works hard because she wants her wallets to be high quality. She supplements her income by making peanut butter. Her regular customers are her neighbors and she earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. She is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy the supplies she needs to make wallets and ingredients to make peanut butter. She dreams that her businesses will continue to grow and expand, and meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study religion, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to make wallets and ingredients to make peanut butter.

loans.name: Thoern

texts.en:
Thoern is 46 years old living with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Kror Kor district. One of her children is still in school. Rice farming and cassava planting are the only main sources for her family’s income to make a living. To supplement the income, her husband makes palm juice. Engaging in this business for 25 years, the current business earns her family a daily income of about US$5 but she is able to save US$2 each day. 
This is the fifth loan for Thoern with VisionFund. With the successful past loans, she has been able to better support her current business. Now she is applying for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a decent vehicle for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy a decent vehicle for her family to use

loans.name: Ar's Group

texts.en:
Ar is 49 and lives in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She is a rice farmer on about two hectares, and she raises pigs in the local area to support her daily cost of living. She has been in this business for ages.

Ar joins VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as a first time borrower. She is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs to a healthy condition and progressively to better her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Rojita

texts.en:
Rojita runs a kiosk to generate income for her family. Rojita opened her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $ 400.

She is taking a loan of $600 to add inventory to her business; she will use the loan to buy sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.  

Rojita  is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Buntheoun

texts.en:
Buntheoun, 38, is the father of a little girl; they reside in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. Buntheon farms rice and raises pigs, and he struggles to make a decent income for his family. This business earns him about 19,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Bunthoeun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has completely repaid previous loans, which helped him to sustain his standard of living and increase his family's income. Now, he is seeking a new loan in the amount of 3,400,000 KHR. With this loan, he will buy a mini-tractor to support his farmland as well as for commuting. He hopes this purchase will lessen the burden of transportation fees so that he can make good use of his income to support his children.

loans.use: to buy a mini-tractor to support his farmland.

loans.name: Pom's Group

texts.en: Pom is a 35-year-old married mother of five children who lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, where she earns a living by growing cassava.  She has been in this line of work for 17 years and earns up to 21,700 KHR a day. She uses her income to support her three children, all of whom are in school. She has received three previous loans from VisionFund, and repaid them after using the money to expand her business and keep her children in school. She leads a two-person loan group, and will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticide, and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to increase her income and help her family live a better life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and hire laborers for her farm.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap is 39 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  Her children are in school, and she and her husband earn a living by growing cassava. She has been in this business for 10 years and has received three previous loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She now leads a four-person loan group which is seeking a new loan for 4,500,000 KHR. Pheap will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer, cassava seedlings, insecticide, and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes that she can grow a large crop because this will allow her to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 52 years old. He lives with his brother in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Merab requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays the family is out of resources. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Merab requested loan from Credo for start-up of a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to a country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Merab will pay a toll for his car. After the toll is paid, he plans to serve local people as a taxi driver and earn money. The family will have a source of income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay a toll for his car.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom, 63, is a widow and mother of a schoolchild. She is a local farmer who plants edible arum and mango as the main source of family income. She has been in this business for 18 years, and it earns her about 11,400 KHR per day. 

Sarom, a third-time borrower, forms a group of two with a second-time borrower. After her past loan which she has repaid completely, she feels empowered to stabilize her business and improve her standard of living. Now, she and her group member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Sarom will use her loan portion to buy a good arum seedling and to plow the land for the planting season. She hopes that she will receive double yield and increase the income from her business so she can keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy a seedling and to plow the land.

loans.name: Neat's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Neat is 31 years old and married. Rice farming and cassava planting are her primary source of income. Her 13 year engagement in farming has helped her to earn a current average of about 15,800 KHR. 

This is the second microloan for Neat’s group with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Neat managed her past loan wisely to expand her business and sustain her lifestyle. For this cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Neat will use her loan portion to buy rice seed, cassava seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticide, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to gain high yield and earn a better income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, cassava seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticide and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 33 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. His parents also live with him in Ditsi village, Gori district. The family has a milk cow which is milked to make cheese which is sold locally at the markets.  They also own a plot of land where they grow haricot, maize, and tomatoes. The harvested products are sold among their villagers and they receive a small monthly income. 

Ramaz requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Ramaz is requesting a loan from Credo to start a family business. The Kiva/Credo start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Ramaz will use the loan to purchase liquid gas to fill up his gas containers which will be installed in his car. In their village, there is no gas installed in the houses, so he will fill up the big containers and help his villagers to charge their small gas balloons, which is used mainly for cooking. Ramaz is very experienced in this field as he had this business before and still has the containers, which will economize his expenses and grow the profit. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business and another part used to cultivate more land and plant more vegetables. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a liquid gas.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул жительница города Сарбанд, расположенного на юго-западе Таджикистана. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и у нее есть сын и дочь. В данное время ее муж и сын находятся на заработках за пределами страны, а дочь работает в Дорожно-эксплуатационном управлении города Сарбанд. Сама Сафаргул раньше в течение 5 лет работала в сфере торговли, однако по причине болезни она вынуждена была прекратить свою деятельность и больше года как не работала. Теперь после полного выздоровления она хочет заново начать свой торговый бизнес. Для этого у нее есть торговая точка, но нет товара. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. На полученный кредит она намерена закупить картошку и начать торговлю.
texts.en:
Safargul is a resident of the city of Sarband, located in south-western Tajikistan.  She is 50 years old, married, and she has a son and a daughter.

At the moment, her husband and son are working abroad, and her daughter is employed by the administration of road management of the city of Sarband.

As for Safargul, she used to work in retail (for five years), but was forced to cease her activity because she became ill, so she did not work for more than a year.  Having completely recovered, she now wants to resume her commercial activity.  She currently has a retail outlet, but no merchandise.  This is the reason why she has requested a loan.

She intends to use her loan to buy some potatoes and start selling again.

loans.use: Для закупа картошки, чтобы начать свою деятельность

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is from a small village in the Kvareli district. She is married and lives with her 33-year-old son, her daughter-in-law, mother-in-law and two infant granddaughters. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Nargiz is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a milk cow, a calf and a pig. She milks the cow and produces dairy products for selling. 

In addition, the family has a 0.46 hectare vineyard and 1.75 hectares of agricultural land, where cucumbers and watermelons are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. Nargiz is a very hardworking woman and has rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing watermelon seeds and fertilizers for the land. The family will be able to grow watermelon for selling and thus increase their income. With increased income Nargiz will provide better living conditions for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Odina

texts.ru: Одина живет в сельской местности, не далеко от города. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Двое детей дошкольного возраста. Супруг занимается ремонтами и строительствами домов и работает он по сезону. Сама же Одина много лет проработала на ферме дояркой. Во время кризиса в мире так получилось, что сначала задерживали зарплату рабочим , а потом и совсем она попала под сокращение. Она была одна из передовиков на ферме. Бывало, что она в день доила коров  до 100 литров молока. Ей тяжело было расставаться со скотом, она была привязана к нему.  Но была вынуждена покинуть ферму. У нее большой опыт в сфере животноводства. После сокращения она начала разводить скот у себя дома. По началу было тяжко,  но со временем она преодолели все трудности.  По уходу за скотом ей помогают ее старшие дети.  Через соседей она узнала про Арванд, обратилась за кредитом. На полученный кредит она приобретет скот.  Она очень благодарна Арванду за поддержку и планирует дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Odina lives in a rural area just outside of a city.  She's married and has five children.  Two are school-aged.  Her spouse works building and repairing homes and only works seasonally. Odina herself worked for many years on a dairy farm.  During the recent, worldwide crisis, her wages were at first withheld, and then she was laid off all together.  She was one of the farm's best workers, sometimes milking up to one hundred liters.  It was difficult for her to part with her cow, she had bonded with them.  It was, however, inevitable.  

She has quite a bit of experience with livestock. After she was laid off, she began breeding cows on her land.  At first it was difficult, but with time, it became easier.  Her older children help her with the work.  Her neighbor told her about Arvand and she came in for a loan.  With the funds, she will buy livestock.  She is very grateful to Arvand for the support and she plans on further collaboration.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en: Serafina is taking a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks of items to keep in her store such as sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $50.00. Serafina is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 61 years old and is widowed. Josefina sells vegetables in the market. She has been doing this business for five years. She usually receives an income of PHP 2,000 a week. At this moment, Josefina is asking a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy onions, garlic, cabbage, tomatoes, and string beans to sell. She believes that through her loan, her business will improve as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, cabbage, tomatoes, and string beans to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has operated a retail store for three years and one month. Aside from the retail store, she also offers viand (tasty dishes) as an additional source of income. Gloria is married with five children; only her youngest child goes to school.

Gloria would like to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 to allow her to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, trays of eggs, kilograms of sugar, canned goods, and soap for her retail store. 

She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan so she can earn a greater income, which will enable her to cover her household expenses, educate her youngest child, and improve her way of living.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, trays of eggs, kilograms of sugar, canned goods, and soap for her retail store.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager residing in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Kong is married and has four children. One hectare of cassava and a half hectare of rice are her main sources of income, which is used to support her daily food consumption. Kong has been in the farming business for ages, and she earns about 20,900 KHR per day. 

Kong, a third time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is a member of a three-person group applying for a new loan. Kong has utilized her past loans wisely to sustain and grow her business and to afford three meals a day for her family. Now, she and one of her group members are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while a remaining member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to purchase potash and pesticides and to pay for farming labor costs. She hopes to grow her cash crops fruitfully and on time so that she can buy an additional plot of farmland to enlarge her profits.

loans.use: to purchase potash and pesticides and to pay for labor costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rer's Group

texts.en:
Rer, 38, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. Three of her four children are dependents and still in school. To feed the family, Rer and her husband earn a living through buying and selling garbage and by working for others for a fee in the local area. Having been in this business for 10 years, they earn about 8,000 KHR per day to spend on their family’s needs. 

This is not Rer's first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund. Rer has used the loans to improve her family’s standard of living and to keep her children in school. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy garbage to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income in order to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy garbage to resell

loans.name: Foziljon

texts.ru: Фозилчон молодой парень в возрасте 29 лет, женат имеет одного ребёнка. Занимается откармливанием скота у себя дома. Ему помогает в этом жена. Сам Фозилчон по профессии каменщик. Собирает камни в горах и продаёт жителям села для стройки домов. Жена также дома в свободное время занимается шитьем. От купли продаже скота они получают приличный доход и поэтому Фозилчон хочет получить  в Арванд кредит  для  покупки одной головы скота и увеличить свое деятельность. Фозилчон заранее  благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Foziljon is a young man, age 27.  He's married and has one child.  His profession is fattening cattle on his property.  His wife helps him with this work.  Foziljon is a stonemason by trade.  He gathers rocks in the mountains and sells them to villagers to build their homes.  In her spare time, his wife works in the home as a seamstress.  They receive a decent income from the sale of cattle and therefore Foziljon wants to take out a loan with Arvand to buy one cow to expand his business.  Foziljon thanks Arvand for the support.

loans.use: for the purchase of livestock

loans.name: Goychak

texts.en:
Goychak is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. He stands at their yard in front of the stable for the animals.
Goychak is 48 years old and the mother of three children. The children are all grown and have their own families who also need help. This is why Goychak would herself like to help her children. The scope of her engagement is cattle breeding. She keeps cows by her home and sells meat and milk products at the bazaar. She also decided to raise sheep. Goychak plans to sell wool from the sheep and earn a small income from this.

With the loan has applied for, she will buy sheep and cattle for breeding and hopes that her plans are realize.

loans.use: To buy sheep and cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is married. He has four children: a married daughter, aged 35, a married son, aged 34, another son, aged 32, and his youngest, who is 26 years old. The youngest works as a driver, at a water supplies department. Arif is a taxi driver, and as the head of household, his income helps cover the family's expenses, such as food and basic services. His youngest son supports the family financially, as well.

The loan Arif is requesting is to cover the expenses for his car repair work. Arif's dream is to buy a new vehicle, which would provide him with opportunities to work without any risks on the road. He needs Kiva's support, because he has great aspirations to improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To cover the expenses for his taxi car repair work

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan has been involved in agriculture for more than 15 years. He runs a farm which includes 10 cows, 2 pigs and 20 chickens. Vahan is a very hardworking farmer and he does his best to gather income and sustain his family. He lives with his wife, son and daughter who help him with the farm.

As Vahan does not have sufficient financial funds to expand his farm, he has applied for this loan. With the loan's help Vahan will purchase  8 oxen for increasing the number of livestock. This will enable him to gather more agricultural income and improve his family's life.

loans.use: to pay for 8 oxen for increasing the number of livestock

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living
conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy more veterinary medicine and equipment to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to improve both her business and her sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, her income, and her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more veterinary medicine and equipment.

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en: Nhu is requesting a new loan to repair her stall in order to have a good place to serve her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her stall in order to have a good place to serve her customers

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is requesting a new loan to buy hairdressing tools and cosmetic products. She took out and repaid a previous loan which helped her expand her business, earn a higher income and provide better support to her family. She hopes that another loan will help her continue to increase the size of her business, raise her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair dressing tools and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting a new loan to buy snack foods and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy snack foods and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy old televisions and speakers so he can repair them and sell them to his customers. Hoa's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy old televisions and speakers to repair

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, el tiene 31 años de edad, empezó vendiendo llaveros en la esquina de la nueve de octubre, luego le sugirieron que vendería más en los centros educativos, y desde ahí a tenido muchas ventas, y a podido abrir un mercado bueno de venta de llaveros.

El trabaja solo, no recibe ayuda de nadie, su labor empieza a las 8:00 de la mañana, termina a las 20:00 de la noche. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de llaveros, las dificultades que se le presentan en su trabajo son: su discapacidad ya que es ciego y en ocasiones le pasan billetes falsos. También cuando llueve y el piso esta mojado suele caerse y es muy peligroso. El no está casado, y no tiene hijos.

Con el préstamo el cliente va a comprar llaveros, y artículos, para poder incrementar su negocio y así tener más ingresos económicos.  Sus metas para un futuro es de tener salud, mejorar su situación económica, tener una casa propia, dar empleo a personas que tienen la misma discapacidad que tiene el, para que esas personas puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
This client is 31 years old and lives in Guayaquil.  He began selling keychains on October 9.  Later it was suggested to him that he could sell more at the schools.  He has made many sales since he has been able to create a new market for keychains.  

The borrower works alone and receives help from no one.  He begins his work selling keychains at 8:00 A.M. and finishes at 8:00 P.M.  The difficulties that he must face in his work include dealing with his disability (he is blind) and the occasional customer who pays with counterfeit money.  Whenever it rains, the ground becomes wet and dangerous since he is at risk of falling.  The borrower is not married and has no children.

With this loan, the borrower will buy keychains and other items so that he can increase his business.  As a result, he will earn more income.  His goals for the future include being healthy, improving his financial situation, and having a house of his own.  He would also like to provide jobs to people who have the same disability so that they can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy keychains and other accessories.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Man is a 43-year-old father of five children. He has been farming rice and repairing motors for several years, earning about 20,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Man is requesting a loan of 4,000,000KHR from VisoinFund to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow his rice more productively so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is requesting a new loan to buy good quality rices and food ingredients to better serve his customers. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. 

His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall, increasing sales, and help him improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality rices and food ingredients in order to better serve his customers.

loans.name: Nasanbat

texts.en:
Mr. Nasanbat, 38 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

His wife has been working as a saleswoman at a private business entity since 2008. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for six years, and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field, such as knowing where to pick up customers, and which road is quicker to reach the desired destination. 

The house the family lives in has been deteriorated over the years, and needs some serious repair as well as insulation. Because of the vulnerable house door, the family freezes down to their cores, and frosts forms around the side of the door.  

Nasanbat is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase insulation and building materials such as fiberglass, bricks, cement, and planks. As a result, the family will live in a comfortable and warm place, and burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, cement, bricks, and planks to repair his house.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
This is Eugenia, 48, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She has children and is married to Larry, a taxi driver. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eugenia operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy biscuits from a wholesaler, then sell them to customers with a profit. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales daily.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of biscuits to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Eugenia dreams to have a room for all her products and have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of biscuits for repacking.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Mr.Ganbold is 42 years old lives with his wife and two children in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Dolgor, is a nurse in a local hospital; his son Gantogtoh, 4, and daughter Ganzaya, 3, go to a local kindergarten. 

The borrower has been running organic dairy products sales in a rental counter of a local market since 2010.  To run his business successfully, he has built close relationships with herders and customers. 

He is now requesting 6,900,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic milk and dairy products to sell to local customers. He is a hardworking, diligent, and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic milk and dairy products to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Marina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marina es originaria de la linda ciudad de Estelí, su estado civil es soltera no tiene hijos y su edad es de 49 años.

 Se caracteriza por ser una mujer de buenos valores morales.
Marina trabaja como empleada domestica en una familia en Estelí desde hace mas de cinco años su función es preparar los alimentos, lavar ropa y cuidar a los hijos de la familia empleadora.

solicita un crédito a Marina para comprar un refrigerador, ya que lo necesita para refrigerar sus alimentos. 

manifiesta que los créditos anteriores han sido de gran importancia para el desarrollo de su familia, ya que ha mejorado su vivienda y ha comprado algunos electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Marina is 49 years old, single, and does not have children. She is a native of the beautiful city of Estelí. She says she is known for being a person with good moral values.

For more than five years Marina has been a domestic worker for a family in Estelí. She prepares meals, washes clothes and cares for the children of her employer.

Marina is requesting this loan to buy a refrigerator to keep her food fresh. She says the previous loans she has received were very important for her family since they allowed her to make home improvements and buy a few appliances.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam, 52, lives with her husband and seven children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Three of their children are dependents and still in school. To feed the family, Seam and her husband earn a living as farmers and have been farming rice and chilies for 18 years, earning about 20,000 Riels (KHR) per day to spend for their family's needs.

Seam has had and repaid three loans through VisionFund, which have helped her to relieve her family's financial burden. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Seam wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes this loan will her to get a high yield from her plantation so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: María Girlesa

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, desde que se casó se dedicó a su hogar y posteriormente al cuidado de sus dos hijos de once y ocho años de edad. Para contribuir con  los gastos del hogar comenzó a vender calzado importado de España, ya que una prima se encuentra radicada en este país.
Desde hace año y medio se separó de su esposo y debió asumir todas las responsabilidades de su casa y la educación de sus hijos ya que su cónyuge no se hizo cargo. Gracias a su actividad esta mujer les brinda a sus hijos alimentación y una vivienda diga. Hoy quiere dedicarse de lleno a su negocio con el fin de generar mayores ganancias y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por esta razón se  encuentra solicitado un crédito para la compra de calzado.
Su mayor sueño es poder garantizarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad y mejores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. After she was married, María worked maintaining her house and then caring for her two children, ages 11 and 8. To contribute toward household expenses, she began to sell footwear imported from Spain, which is where her cousin lives.

A year and half ago, María separated from her husband and had to assume all of the responsibilities of her home, including the education of her children, because her husband has not taken responsibility. Thanks to her footwear business, María has been able to provide her children with food and a good home. Now María would like to work full-time at her business with the intention of generating more profit and improving her family’s living conditions. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy footwear. Her greatest dream is to be able to guarantee her children a quality education and better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Emprendedoras es un grupo de 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son conocidas en el barrio por su gran unión y trabajo. Se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias para que puedan tener todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante.
Perla es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, es una buena vendedora y sus clientes siempre están muy contentos con los productos que les ofrece. Cuenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de buzos, camperas, medias, gorras y demás, ya que se acerca la época de frío y quiere poder tener un buen stock para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Las Emprendedoras [The Entrepreneurs] is a group with 17 female members from the city of Villa Elisa. They are well-known in the neighborhood due to their strong unity and hard work. They do their utmost to get ahead and help their families, so that they can have everything that they need to move forward in life.

Perla is a member of this group, and works selling all kinds of clothing. She is good at this job, and her customers are always really happy with the products that she offers. She says that she started her business with very little but, thanks to her hard work, she is doing well.

Perla has requested this loan to be able to buy sweatpants, jackets, socks, caps, and other items. The cold season is coming soon, so she wants to have good stock levels so that she can continue offering items to her customers.

loans.use: To buy sweatpants, jackets, socks, caps, and other items.

loans.name: Edelberto Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Edelberto Antonio vive en una comarca al sur de la capital casado, trabaja  como jardinero en una universidad es un joven responsable, honesto  realiza su trabajo con mucho entusiasmo ya que considera que con su trabajo  está aportando a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y es por esta razón que está solicitando a kiva y ceprodel  un crédito para hacer un anexo en su vivienda para acondicionar el área de  la cocina  para darles mayor comodidad y seguridad  a su pequeños hijos y su esposa.

Agradeciendo mucho por el crédito ya que de esta manera podrá ir mejorando su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Edelberto Antonio lives in a region to the south of the capital.  He's married and works as a gardener at a university.  He's a responsible and honest young man who does his job with great enthusiasm because he thinks his job is bringing better living conditions to his family.

This is why he's requesting a loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL.  He's going to put an addition on his house to set up the kitchen area and give his young children and his wife greater comfort and security.

He's grateful for the loan because he'll be able to keep on improving his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old and lives in Marapong, Sibutad. She is married and has 4 children.

Norma has a rug and potholder making business and earns approximately 3500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase used cloth needed to make a product.

Norma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing needed to make a product

loans.name: Sokong's Group

texts.en:
Sokong, 32, is married with four dependent children; three are in school while the remaining one is too young for school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province's Moung Russey district and the main sources of her family's income are from farming rice and growing chilies. She has been running her business for 11 years, earning about 25,000 Riels (KHR) per day.

She has had five loans from Kiva's partner, VisionFund, and has effectively used them to sustain her family's business, support her family's needs and save some money from the earnings for the future. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Santos Avilio

texts.es:
El señor santos avilio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja  en un cetro de compra de Managua en el área de limpieza empezando su jornada de trabajo a las 7 de la mañana y terminando a las 4 pm.

Padre de familia responsable siempre pendiente por el bienestar de su familia.

Don santo está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de zinc  y madera para hacerle el cambio del entechado de su casa que está en mal estado.

Agradeciendo mucho a kiva y ceprodel porque gracias a los crédito que se le han otorgado ha mejorado su casa  para mayor comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Avilio lives in the city of Managua.  He works in cleaning services in a shopping center in Managua, starting his day at 7 in the morning and finishing at 4 in the afternoon.  He's a responsible father, always looking after his family's welfare.

Santos is requesting a loan to invest in buying corrugated metal and wood to change the roof of his house, which is in bad condition.

He's very grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL because thanks to the loans he has received he has improved his house so his family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Heb's Group

texts.en:
Heb is 47 and married. She has two children. Living in a village of the Ek Phnom district, Hem has farmed rice and raised cows for 4 years. She complements that income by selling desserts. Heb manages to earn about 70,000 Riels (KHR) per day to feed her family.

Heb has taken out and completely repaid five loans through VisionFund. The loans have helped her better support her family with enough food. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Heb wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland and to pay for plowing the field. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
Ben, 63, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Ek Phnom district. She has six children. She has been farming rice and catching fish for 31 years, and the current business earns her family about 40,000 Riels (KHR) per day.

There are two members in this group and they both have had six loans from VisionFund. Ben completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her current business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy a boat to support her fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy a boat to support her fishing business

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is 43 years old and lives in Tugas, Baliangao. She is married and has 4 children.

To earn a living, Ma. Linda has a business selling snacks. She earns about 3200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Ma. Linda has requested a loan to pay her son's tuition fees.

Ma. Linda has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr Francisco es comerciante hace más de15 años, tiene una despensa y carnicería en su casa en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
Está casado con la Sra. Ana hace mas de 30 años tuvieron 4 Hijos que ya son todos mayores de edad e independientes a ellos. También cuenta que comenzó desde muy abajo, que tuvo que aguantar muchas cosas para salir adelante, que gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su Señora ya tienen una despensa y carnicería bien surtida.
Cuenta que su mayor sueño es que su hija pueda culminar su estudio universitario, que sea una profesional y que pueda trabajar, para no pasar por los que ellos han pasado.
El solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de animales para la faena y venta en su carnicería, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco has been a merchant for more than 15 years.  He has a store and butcher shop in his house in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

He has been married to Ana for more than 30 years.  They had four children, all of them adults now and independent.

He says he started at the bottom and had to suffer a lot to get ahead.  Thanks to his effort and his wife's, now they have a well-stocked store and butcher shop.

He says his biggest dream is for his daughter to finish her university studies, become a professional, and be able to work so she doesn't have to go through what they have.

He's requesting this loan to invest in buying animals to butcher and sell in his butcher shop.  This way he'll be able to continue filling his customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy animals to butcher and sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 66 years old and lives in Salimpuno. She is married and has four children. Lydia has a shop that sells assorted groceries and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase additional inventory of groceries and beverages. Lydia has been a member of PMPC for almost six years.

loans.use: To purchase 20 boxes of assorted grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To build up his capital again by buying shoes for resale.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 8 de Diciembre está en su ciclo número 14 del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cinco integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marta, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas, venta de ropas y otras actividades con lo cual tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan. Ella se define como una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Marta solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, ya que con ello podrá seguir ofreciendo gran variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called "8 de Diciembre" [December 8th] is in its fourteenth cycle with the committee program, where everyone works and helps one another to get ahead.  They are carrying out a poverty elimination survey; five members find themselves below the poverty line, but they work hard to get ahead. 

One of the group members is Marta; in her last survey, she showed a poverty level within level one.  She says that she makes a living in selling foods, clothing, and in other activities; through this, she has the means to to be able to help her family and to give them everything they need.  She is defined as a very fighting and self-sacrificing person.

Marta is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of items, so that she will be able to continue offering a great variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 58 años de edad, está casada con Roberto quien es artesano y padre de sus 2 hijos Wilson de 27 años y Neri de 21 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de su esposo, sus hijos y 2 nietos, en su propia casa.Elena se dedica a la venta de comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, entre otros ,para esto estableció una bodega en su propia casa. Atiende amablemente a sus clientes desde muy temprano y afortunadamente le va muy bien porque ya tiene 2 años dedicándose a este trabajo y ha logrado crecer a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Trabaja sola aunque en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hija. Considera que su negocio es rentable por las ganancias que a diario obtiene y por las ventas que a diario realiza, además estos ingresos económicos le sirven para comprar todo lo que hace falta en su hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 400, está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio y asegura que será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas . Con el monto solicitado comprará productos comestibles al por mayor para su bodega, como azúcar, arroz, huevos , entre otros.
texts.en:
Elena, 58 years old, is married to Robert who is an artisan and the father of her two children, 27-year-old Wilson and 21-year-old Neri. She lives in the company of her husband, her children and two grandchildren, in her own house.

Elena makes a living selling food such as rice, sugar, bread and eggs, among others. For this purpose she established a bodega in her own house. She attends to her clients with kindness from very early and luckily it has been going well because she has had this business for 2 years and she has succeeded in growing it through much effort and dedication. She works alone although on occasions she receives help from her daughter. She considers her business to be profitable based on the daily revenues and sales. In addition, this economic income helps her buy everything that she needs for her home.

At this opportunity she is requesting 400 soles. She is happy to know that she has the financial support to advance with the progress of her business and she commits to being punctual with her payments. With the requested amount she will buy edible products at wholesale for her bodega, such as sugar, rice and eggs, among others.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar and eggs, among others

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 56 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Concepcion has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Concepcion has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients needed to make snacks to sell.

Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for nearly eight years.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Faisi

texts.en:
Age 50, Faisi is a married woman with five children who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For five years now she has been selling fish. The business is very lucrative since fish is a staple food in the area. She also farms to supplement her income.

Being the good mother that she is, Faisi desires to educate her children so they may attain college degrees. Faisi intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Alexa

texts.en:
Alexa  is 65 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with five children. 

Alexa has a shop where she sells ripe bananas. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase raw bananas.

Alexa has been a member of PMPC for nearly nine years.

loans.use: To purchase 200 kilos of raw bananas.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Age 53, Peninah is a married lady with five children who resides in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a produce business where she sells beans and ground nuts. She has run this business for seven years now. She also farms to supplement her income. Her dream is to build a permanent house for her family despite having inadequate capital. Peninah is requesting a loan to buy beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Barrio Alegre Group

texts.es:
Barrio Alegre es un grupo de la ciudad de Caacupé, donde las integrantes vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso para ellas y sus familias. Son 24 mujeres que se esfuerzan día a día para salir adelante.
Nicasia es una de estas mujeres, y comenta que gracias a su grupo ha logrado mejorar mucho y salir adelante, su familia se ha visto beneficiada y su negocio ha mejorado. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y con ello está dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan, y que no les falte nada.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas de estación, como ser bananas, piñas, naranjas, y demás. Agradecen todas las integrantes por la oportunidad que están ofrecieciendoles, pues les ayudarán a crecer.
texts.en:
Barrio Alegre [Happy Neighborhood] is a group in the city of Caacupe, where the members saw a great opportunity for progress for themselves and their families. They are 24 women who make an effort day by day to get ahead.

Nicasia is one of these women, and she says that thanks to her group she has succeeded in improving greatly and moving forward. Her family has benefited and her business has gotten better. She makes a living selling fruits and with this business she is giving her family all that they need, so that they do not want for anything. 

She is requesting this loan to buy seasonal fruits, such as bananas, pineapples, oranges and others. 

She is grateful to all of the members for the opportunity they are offering her, since they help each other to grow.

loans.use: to buy bananas, pineapples, oranges and other fruits

loans.name: Gladis Margarita

texts.es: Doña Gladis de 38 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de  maiz y maicillo, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa propia pero no posee los servicios basicos (agua y luz),pero con lo que vende de sus granos basicos puede llevar un poco de lo que su familia necesita junto con su esposo, ella solicita credito para poder comprar mas insumos agricolas y asi seguirle dando lo que su familia necesita.
texts.en:
Gladis, 38, cultivates corn and sorghum. She lives with her husband and their four children in their own home but do not have basic services (water and electricity), but with what she makes selling the grains, she can provide a little of what her family needs along with her husband.

She is requesting this loan to buy more agricultural supplies so she can keep providing what her family needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
This is Guillerma, age 45, who is a resident of Batasan, Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Elizaldy, a self employed man, and she is a mother to her children. She and her family manage their own business while sustaining their everyday expenses.

Guillerma operates a bookbinding business. This business is in demand, especially by schools and businesses. Aside from her bookbinding business, she also has a photocopy and printing center. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy cover binding, bond paper, toner and other things needed in her business.

Guillerma hopes to have other branches and dreams of attracting more customers. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials such as cover binding, paper and toner for her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 57 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines.  She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by  the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Anita is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She hopes to make it big in business and become successful. She dreams of giving her family a good life.  Anita meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages .

loans.name: Mbabazi

texts.en:
Mbabazi is 30 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She owns a retail shop in Kagadi, Uganda and has been in this business for two years. She also rears animals to supplement her income. She was inspired in this business by a good lifestyle that she wanted to live compared to the poverty that she was born in. 

Mbabazi is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy soda and general merchandise to sell.  She dreams of building a  house for her family and educating them up to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase soda and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deisy tiene la edad de 62 años, está casada y vive con el esposo. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y semillas y un poco de materiales para iniciar un proyecto de hidroponía. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al proyecto para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Deisy is 62 years old, is married and lives with her spouse. She would like a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, as well as some supplies to begin a hydroponic project. She would like to be able to adequately maintain the project so that the can have better production and thus more economic gains. 

In the future, she hopes to give a better quality of life and economic stability to her family, and she also hopes to continue growing as a person and as a producer. This is the first loan that she has received from FEDECOSUR. She has never had a bank loan before, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan that is easier to access and that has a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy hydroponic supplies.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 34 year old woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has a bar and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for children.

Her main clients are bus an taxi drivers and hence she is assured of sales everyday.  Price fluctuation and lack of appropriate storage facilities pose a challenge to her business growth while her dream is to own a modern bar.  Jackline intends to use the loan to buy a deep freezer.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida.  Her previous loan was a big help for her business.  She was able to buy all the needed products and supplies and she was able to generate more income.  She has been in this business for ten years now.  As a widow, she is working hard to provide income for her family's everyday needs and expenses.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of supplies and products like dresses and shirts.  Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida dreams to have a bigger place for her business and hopes to have a happy life.  She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners that gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of supplies and products such as dresses and shirts that she needs in her business

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
This is Blesilda.  She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of curtains, bed sheets, pillow cases and other dry goods.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy different kinds of dry goods like curtains, bed sheets, pillow cases and other products.  Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Blesilda hopes to have more goods to sell and to have more customers.  She dreams to give her children a good and high quality education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for curtains, bed sheets, pillowcases and other dry goods needed in her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 29 year old businessman in Thika.  He is a shoe maker as well as a cobbler.  This is a business he has done for the past three years.  He is married to Ann and together they are blessed with two children.  Julius earns a monthly income of KES 13,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second business loan from KADET LTD.  He will use the loan to purchase more leather and shoe soles for his shoe making business.  He will use the proceeds from the business to educate his children.  He hopes to have a well sustained family.

loans.use: to purchase  more leather and shoe soles

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 44 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao.  She is a widow with 4 children. 

Juanita works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for a living.  She has been doing this for 2 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase fishing tools.  Jaunita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Jemmy

texts.en:
Jemmy is 39 years old, married, and has five children. She has been farming for about five years and earns an income of about 8,300 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She hopes to be a great farmer and open a retail shop in order to boost her profits. Her income enables her to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old married with six children between the age of three and 15 years.  She has been running her retail shop for a period of two years with an income of approximately 7,500 KES a month. 

She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD and wants to use it to buy stocks of flour, soap and detergent for sale.  She hopes to own a wholesale shop and a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour, soap and detergent for sale.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: .Silvia, de 30 años de edad, está casada con Jorge Luis quien es padre de su hijo de 2 años, además ella tiene 4 hijos más de su primer esposo, vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia la cual llego a obtener gracias a su trabajo. La actividad que realiza Silvia es la venta de dulces de hielo conocidos en su ciudad como “chupetes”, cuenta con una refrigeradora y recipientes de congelación donde coloca sus productos para venderlos en un colegio ubicado cerca a su casa en donde cuenta con un puesto fijo. Prepara los chupetes con frutas frescas regionales como guanábana, mango,coco o banana. Se inició en esta actividad hace más de 6 años y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola. Considera a su  negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos . Complementa este negocio con la venta de bebidas gasificadas de diversos tamaños y sabores.Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos quienes son su principal motivación para seguir progresando, por tanto tiene planes de seguir adelante y ampliar la capacidad de productos disponibles. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200 soles, está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio por otro lado asegura que será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes que usa en la elaboración de los dulces de hielo tales como frutas, azúcar y bolsas y tambien comprará bebidas gasificadas.
texts.en:
Silvia, 30, is married to Luis, the father of her two-year-old son. She has four more children from her previous marriage. Silvia lives with her family in their own house, which she bought thanks to her job. Silvia sells frozen sweets, known as “chupetes” in her city. She has a freezer and containers where she displays her products in a school located near her house, where she also sells them.
Silvia makes the chupetes with fresh fruits found locally, such as soursop, mango, coconut or banana. She started this line of work more than six years ago, and so far, she has worked alone. She considers her business to be fairly profitable because of the demand her products have. She complements this business selling different types and sizes of sodas. Silvia enjoys her work, because it gives her an income to support the home expenses and her children’s needs, which are her motivation to progress. She has plans to keep working and expand her capacity.

Silvia is requesting a loan of 1200 soles [PEN]. She is happy because she knows that this financial support will help her get ahead with her business. She promises to pay the installments on time. With the money, she will buy some supplies she needs for making her frozen sweets, such as fruits, sugar and bags, and she will also buy sodas.

loans.use: to buy fruits and sodas.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with 2 children.  Thelma is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Thelma is a farmer and grows cattle and pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 5 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials needed for house repair.  Thelma has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials needed for house repair

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 25 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable, honesto y trabajador. Actualmente vive con su familia, se dedica a ser agricultor su principal siembra es el maíz. Carlos solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old. He says he is very responsible, honest and hardworking. He lives with his family and works as a farmer. His principle crop is corn.

Carlos is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide and other agricultural supplies. He hopes to receive this help because he has no other source of credit and he wants to continue to bring home bread to his family each day without interruption.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Las 14 integrantes cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerza y dan todo de sí, en las capacitaciones y son muy optimistas ya que desean crecer. Las Señoras están muy agradecidas con kiva y Fundación paraguaya por el gran apoyo que les brinda atreves de los créditos.
Maria es la presidenta de este grupo y dice que gracias a su trabajo su economía mejoro mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo y con ello da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para que no les falte nada. Maria se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que sus comestibles son muy ricos y sus clientes siempre le hacen muchos pedidos.
Pide este crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con los ricos comestibles que hace.
texts.en:
The 14 members of the group carry out various activities; each one of them displays energy and in training sessions they give their all. They are very optimistic, now that they are committed to growth. And the women are very grateful to Kiva and the Fundacion Paraguaya for the great help that's offered through these loans.

Maria is president of this group and she says that, thanks to her work, her economic situation is much improved. She dedicates herself to selling foods of all types. And with her earnings, she provides her family with all they need so they will lack nothing. Maria has built a very good clientele because her foods are very tasty and her customers always have many requests.

Maria is requesting this loan to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies to be able to continue delighting her customers with the rich foods she prepares.

loans.use: buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other food supplies.

loans.name: Olga Mercedes

texts.es:
Olga tiene 32 años de edad estado civil soltera vive con sus padres vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, esta conformada por 13 socios se encuentra a  40 minutos de la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura.

Olga se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra y venta de naranjilla, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para la compra de urea, fungicidas, semilla, abono para la naranjilla. Con el crédito que le otorga la cooperativa mejorara la calidad en el producto.

Sus compras las realiza en el cantón Guaranda. El sueño es ser mejores productores.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son no poder comunicarse no tener medio de transporte y las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo.

"Esta muy agradecida por el crédito anterior".
texts.en:
Olga is 32, single, and lives with her parents in the Guaranda province of Bolivar.

She is a member of the VRC Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons), which is dedicated to agriculture, made up of 13 members and located 40 minutes from the town of Santa Martha in Guaranda.

Olga plants and sells naranjilla (an edible orange fruit cultivated in South America). She also raises cattle. She is requesting a loan to buy urea, fungicides, seed and fertilizer for the naranjilla. With the loan granted by the cooperative, she will improve the quality of her product. She makes her purchases in Guaranda. Her dream is to be a top producer.

Some challenges she faces are not being able to communicate, not having transportation and pests. 

During her free time she likes to take walks.

She is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: urea, fungicides, seed, fertilizer for naranjilla.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius, now 51 years old, used his previous loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell in his retail shop. These goods included cooking fat, sugar, flour, and tea leaves, among other items. It was profitable and he was able to pay back the loan amount. 

Besides the retail shop, he also has a butchery business. He sells meat and also supplies meat to several hotels and restaurants in town.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of meat for selling. He anticipates that he will generate more income, since the demand for meat is high. He will use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children.
