Pius hopes to open another butchery shop as well as expand his retail shop to a wholesale shop. This would make him more income and allow him to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas madres de familias que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar todo lo que necesitan a sus familias. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que luchan por salir adelante.
Maria, una de las integrantes se dedica a la olería, hace todo tipo de materiales de construcción, con el cual surte a algunas empresas y construcciones. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela y que con esto está saliendo adelante y está creciendo en su negocio.
Ella pide este crédito para la compra de arcilla, ya que así podrá seguir haciendo los materiales para la venta, ya que tiene pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir. Agradece ya que su grupo está muy contento con la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 20 women, all of whom are mothers and who make an effort to get ahead and provide all that is necessary to their families. They are hardworking and enterprising women who struggle to move forward.

Maria, one of the members, works in pottery. She makes all types of construction materials, which she supplies to various business and construction sites. She says that she has a very good clientele and that with this, she is getting ahead and her business is growing.

She is requesting this loan to buy clay, so that she will be able to continue making the materials that she sells, since she already has orders which she would like to deliver. She is thankful since her group is very happy with the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clay to make construction materials

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, a 41-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda, is married to Grace and has two children. He is a shopkeeper, and in May of 2012 started selling LED lights. To this point he has sold 100 lights, providing clean energy to 500 people.

Vincent is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Vincent will reinvest the money he makes into expanding this enterprise to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Saigo Enole

texts.en:
Saigo's faming business is doing well, and she has since paid off her loan successfully. She has now acquired a bigger portion of land where she plans to plant different types of crops.

Saigo is hardworking and has acquired a third loan of 40,000 KES to purchase sheep and goats for fattening and resale. She hopes to use the increased proceeds to expand her farming business as well as educate her children.

Saigo's hopes and dreams are to see her family's living standards improve.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Reina Concepción

texts.es:
Reina tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Se separo de su esposo, debido a que la maltrataba sus hijos tienen nueve años y una niña de tres años. Ella se dedica a vender frutas y verduras de manera ambulante de casa en casa en un canasto. Además, realiza trabajos agrícolas, cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz junto con su hermano. Así mismo, cría animales en su casa, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres. Desde la edad de los ocho años, salía a vender tamales y platos típicos. Su vida ha sido muy difícil desde pequeña, pero sigue adelante trabajando por un futuro mejor para sus hijos. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a preparar a sus hijos y llevarlos a la casa de su mamá para que los cuide, mientras tanto ella se va a trabajar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres toretes para repasto y pagar el alquiler del terreno en donde cultiva.  Con la inversión, podrá contar con animales para trabajar y venderlos cuando estén gordos y paguen un buen precio por ellos y tendrá seguro el terreno para seguir cultivando.  Su propósito, es que sus hijos estudien en la universidad, pues ella no tubo esa oportunidad y construir un muro de protección en su casa y cambiarle el techo; pues esta muy deteriorado.
texts.en:
Reina is 27 years old and a single mother of two children. She separated from her husband because he mistreated her children, a 9-year-old boy and a 3-year-old girl. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables walking from house to house with a basket. In addition, she carries out agricultural work. She cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn together with her brother. Also, she raises animals in her house, an activity that she learned from her parents.

Since 8 years old, she went out to sell tamales and traditional food. Her life has been very difficult since she was young, but she continues forward working for a better future for her children. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to get her children ready and to take them to her mother's house so she can care for them while she goes to work.

The loan she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy three young bulls to raise and to pay the rent on the land that she cultivates. With the investment, she will be able to have animals that she can sell when they are fat and fetch a good price, and she will have secured the land so she can continue cultivating. Her goal is for her children to study in the university since she did not have that opportunity, and to construct a protective wall around her house and to change the roof since it is very dilapidated.

loans.use: to buy three young bulls to raise and to pay rent on the land that she cultivates

loans.name: Silvio José

texts.es:
Don Silvio José es un señor de 44 años, padre de cuatro hijos que habitan en la comarca San Agustín ubicada a 15 km del municipio de El Sauce.

Se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad en una Institución desde hace años, labor que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.
 Aunque sea muy poco lo que gana ejerce su trabajo con esmero y empeño, además que es un salario fijo que tiene y con esto cubre los gastos de alimentación de su hogar.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel se lo financien para la compra de dos bicicletas para sus hijos que van a la escuela ya que les toca caminar 3 km diario y con este medio se ahorrarían caminar larga distancia sobre el sol.
Aún con gran dificultad estos niños tienen el interés de aprender y superarse a pesar de que habitan en el campo no faltan a la escuela.

Agradece a Kiva y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le ha brindado y espera que le apruebe este financiamiento para el bien de sus niños que son lo mas importante en su vida.
texts.en:
Silvio José is 44 years old and has four children. They live in the region of San Agustín, which is located 15 kilometers from the municipality of El Sauce. Silvio José has worked for years in a company as a security guard, which allows him to bring home bread to his family each day. Although he may not earn a lot of money, he carries out his work with great care and determination. Moreover, it is a fixed salary he earns, and with it he can feed his family.

Silvio José is requesting a Kiva loan through CEPRODEL to buy two bicycles for his children, who walk three kilometers each day to go to school. The bicycles would save them from having to walk such a long distance in the sun. Silvio José says that even with such great obstacles, his children are interested in learning and bettering themselves, and that although they live in the country, they do not lack for education.

Silvio José is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for the support they have provided him, and he hopes that this loan is approved for the good of his children, who are the most important thing in his life.

loans.use: to buy two bicycles for his children to travel back and forth to school.

loans.name: Jacob Wanambisi

texts.en:
Jacob used his previous loan to to buy more firewood and 10 bags of charcoal, got into the brick-making business, and supplied bricks to people who are building and to developing plots.

Right now, his monthly income from the business is 60000 KES. He is borrowing a loan of 60000 KES, which he intends to use to purchase more stock of firewood. 

He will pay his kids' school fees with the anticipated profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the last ten years, she has earned a living by selling water in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of 20,000 KES to purchase a new water pump for use in her business. Charity will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children, as well as to expand her business.

Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to purchase a new water pump to be used for her business.

loans.name: Guarapi Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Guarapi está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde se están esforzando por salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blanca quien  se dedica a la decoración de eventos. Cuenta que se hizo de muy buena clientela ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos. Su sueño es poder tener un gran local de decoraciones para poder seguir dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas para su decoración, lo que le ayudará a dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ella y sus amigas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, ya que es ayuda no solo para ellas sino también para sus familias.
texts.en:
The Guarapi Group is in its third loan cycle of the women’s committee program. In this program, everyone is striving to get ahead and to help each other through teamwork. The members are all fighters and, above all, entrepreneurs. 

One of the members of the group is Blanca, who has an event decoration business. She says she has gained a very good following of customers because she always does a good job and her customers are very satisfied with her work. Her dream is to have a large decoration shop, from which she could continue to meet her customers’ needs. 

Blanca is requesting this loan to buy decorative fabrics to better serve her customers. She and her friends are grateful for the opportunity they are being given, because it not only helps them, but their families as well.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her event decoration business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene la edad de 23 años, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de semilla de plátano para iniciar este proyecto junto su esposo en una pequeña propiedad que tienen. Ella quiere iniciar este negocio para empezar a producir plátanos para venderlos en las ferias y en los supermercados. Ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Isabel is 23 years old and married with one son.  She is requesting a loan to buy plantain seeds to start a project with her ​​husband on a small property they own.  She wants to start a business producing plantains to sell at fairs and in supermarkets.  

Isabel states that her credit committee has been helpful and provided her a lot of assistance.  She hopes that this project will grow and achieve its objectives and in the future will provide her family a better quality of life and improved economic stability.  

This is Isabel's first loan with Kiva partner FUDECOSUR.  She had not had other loans before through state banks because FUDECOSUR was able to provide a loan more efficiently and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy plantain seeds.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Lomgoul Group

texts.en:
Widowed at a very young age and with her two kids to take care of, Henei is the featured member with the raised hand. She is a member of the Lomgoul Group. After her husband passed away, she moved back to her poor parents' home with her kids. Tragedy struck when her younger daughter was found drowned in the nearby pond, which shook Henei’s life and became the reason to continue to live her life. Starting a new life without her husband and her deceased daughter wasn’t easy at all, but her son would be an orphan if Henei lost hope and cursed herself for the plight she faces. Her son is the only reason why she is back in form to continue her life and start off the business to support her son and herself. Her group members also supported and encouraged her in all possible ways.

 Henei started her own business by selling cosmetic and grocery products.  She used to get the stock from the nearby Army canteen and sold it with a profit in the village and nearby markets. Her supplies consist of talcum powders, hair oils, detergent soaps, tooth-paste, milk powder, detergent powder, etc. With the little profit she made, she also started selling used clothes in her village and neighbouring villages. She gets the used clothes from the main town, which is about 30 kms from the village where she resides. 

 With the extension of the loan from Kiva, Henei decided to get more used clothes from the main market consisting of  T-shirts, Medi-Pants, summer pants, shorts, and cotton shirts as she feels that summer is approaching and selling these items will bring more money. She will sell used clothes as well as continue stocking army canteen supplies for the villagers and the nearby shops.

Henei's dream is to own a house of her own that she and her son can share without feeling any obligations towards anyone. Her community has shown her more support than she feels she and her son deserve. Thus, she is hopeful that with the loan, she will formulate a way to earn her monthly income and do some saving to let her dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is 36 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is married (but separated) with five children. 

To earn a living, Genie has a business selling ripe bananas. She earns about PHP 2800 each month doing this type of work. Genie has a requested a loan to purchase unripe bananas.

Genie has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: To purchase 50 kilos of unripe bananas

loans.name: Ray

texts.es: Ray, de 43 años de edad, está casado con Delia quien es ama de casa y madre de sus 4 hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia.Ray se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos y mototaxis, brinda servicio de vulcanizado, cambio de aceite, lubricación, bajada de motor y otras funciones .Para desarrollar esta actividad cuenta con un local propio acondicionado en su hogar en donde pone a la venta todos los repuestos que requieren sus clientes como pistones, bujía, aros, llantas, frenos, entre otros , además atiende cuidadosamente a todos los clientes que acuden a solicitar su servicio ,razón por la cual lleva en este negocio 7 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su familia. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos gracias al constante crecimiento del sector vehicular en su ciudad. Afortunadamente gracias a los buenos resultados que esta obteniendo , sus ingresos económicos se han incrementado y su camino al progreso continúa, es por ello que desea complementar con nuevas funciones a su establecimiento y contar con el paquete completo de servicio vehicular . En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles y está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos de motos como ejes, llantas, bujías y frenos que son los productos mas solicitados en su puesto de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ray, 43 years old, is married to Delia who is a housewife and mother of their 4 children. They live together in their own house. Ray sells replacement parts for motorbikes and moto-taxis. He offers services such as vulcanizing, oil changes, lubrication, motor repair, and other functions. 

To carry out this activity, Ray uses his own shop, which he constructed in his house. Here he sells all the replacement parts his customers require, such as pistons, spark plugs, piston rings, tires, and brakes, among others. In addition, he attends with care to all the customers who come by to request his services. That's how he has survived in this business for 7 years. He works with the help of his family. 

Ray considers his business sufficiently profitable due to the demand that exists for his products, thanks to the constant growth of the vehicular sector in his city. Fortunately, thanks to the good results the business obtains, his economic income has increased and his path to progress continues. That's why he wants to complement it with new services in his establishment, and to count on a complete package of vehicular services. 

On this occasion, Ray is requesting 1,500 sols, and he feels content in the knowledge that he has the financial help that will permit him to continue the progress of his business. With the requested funds, he will purchase replacement parts for vehicles, including axles, tires, spark plugs, and brakes, which are the products most requested in his shop.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for motor vehicles, including tires, brakes, and spark plugs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is 36 years old and a married mother of three schoolchildren. She resides in Sangke district of Battambang Province. She deals with her family’s hardships through rice farming with support from her husband who uses his spare time to earn extra income via working for other for a fee.  Her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was three loan cycles ago. She has made good use of her previous loans to relieve the family’s burden and keep up a good living standard gradually. 

Now, she is leading a group of four to apply for a new loan. Her group's requested microloan with VisionFund is 4,000,000 KHR.  Sambath whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will spend her loan portion to pay plowing fees for her farmland. She really hopes that she can double her income and better her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees for farmland

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Age 58 and a local farmer from Battambang Province’s EK Phnom district, Sopheap is married and blessed with eleven children. Her main source of income is from her vegetable selling business and the supplementary income is from small-scale vegetable planting, which she has been doing for about 30 years to support herself. This is the seventh time that Sopheap has taken out a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has successfully repaid her past loans which have enabled her to sustain her living and have returned a good income to feed her family and for other necessary expenses. 

Now, she and her fellow group member are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. Sopheap, the leader, will use her loan portion to buy more vegetables to resell. She hopes to replenish fresh vegetables on time and sell them at a high price; thereby, she will earn more income to support herself.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For ten years he has been selling fish and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and support his family. Lack of appropriate preservation equipment and inadequate capital pose a challenge to his business growth while his dream is to buy a refrigerated van. Wilson intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Savoun's Group

texts.en:
Savoun, originally from Battambang Province, is 31 years old and strives to make a living through a single business, rice farming, which she has been with for 10 years. Currently, she has one son who still needs her support as he is still in school. Savoun, a fifth time borrower, joined this group consisting of two female members to apply for a new loan; the other borrower is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Savoun has supported her living in a good manner from the past loans which she has completely paid back. Now, she is seeking 1,200,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for half of her requesting loan amount, 600,000 KHR only. Savoun, the leader, will use her loan portion to buy rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice seasonably so she can gain triple yield with high profit for her child’s sake.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally, 40, is a citizen from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. Besides working for others for a fee, she also has her own businesses including tailoring and chicken raising in order to support the daily basic needs of her family. Phally has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages, and has taken out nine loans which she has repaid successfully. She feels very confident that she can upgrade her living status progressively especially in providing daily food for her family. 

Now, her current requested loan amount is 1,000,000 KHR, the same amount as her co-borrower. She is the group leader and will use her loan portion to buy necessary materials to build a new, decent house for her family. She hopes this purchase will help her to renovate her house in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to build a new, decent house for her family

loans.name: Merlita

texts.es:
Merlita, de 39 años de edad, esta casada con Jorge quien es el padre de sus dos hijos de 20 y 12 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus  hijos en su casa propia, la cual logró construir con  el fruto de su esfuerzo.
Merlita se dedica a la carpintería, desarrolla este trabajo en un taller cercano a su vivienda en el que trabaja desde hace 5 años. Compra la madera que necesita y luego traslada toda esta materia prima a su punto de trabajo en donde su función principal consiste en pulir la madera cuyas piezas serán unidas posteriormente para formar muebles para el hogar y oficinas.Considera que ya tiene los conocimientos básicos para desarrollar sola este trabajo es por eso que poco a poco espera instalar su propio taller.Le gusta su actividad  porque puede estar en su casa el tiempo necesario para cumplir con las funciones que requiere la crianza de sus hijos sin descuidar sus actividades laborales, también le gusta el ingreso económico que le genera su trabajo con el cual puede apoyar a su esposo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de cinceles , brochas, madera y otros materiales de carpintería que son usadas en su trabajo a su vez está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Merlita is 39 years old and is married to Jorge. Together they have two children, ages 20 and 12. She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which they managed to build through their own hard work.

Merlita works in carpentry. She has worked for five years in a workshop near her home. Merlita buys the wood she needs and transports it to the workshop. She then sands the pieces of wood before they are joined to make home and office furniture. 

Merlita believes that she already has the basic knowledge to carry out this work by herself, and she hopes to gradually open up her own workshop. She says she likes carpentry because it allows her enough time to be home to care for her children without having to neglect her work. She also likes the earnings she receives, which allow her to help her husband. 

Merlita is requesting this loan of 2000 PEN to buy chisels, paintbrushes, wood and other carpentry materials that she uses to make furniture. She says she is very happy to know she has financial support that will allow her to move ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy chisels, paintbrushes, wood and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  un hombre emprendedor , tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su cosecha , para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Carlos, age 39, is an enterprising man.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and four children.

He currently requested a loan to buy supplies like manure and fumigants.  He wants to help his coffee crops in order to keep them in good condition during the harvest.  He will do this in order to get a good quality product.

The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of money to continue growing.  They are dependent upon this business activity in order to be able to get ahead.  That is why he is making this loan request.

It is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He does not have other loans in state banks.  FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. Angeline is engaged in a tricycle transport business together with her husband for more than three years now. Angeline is asking for a loan to buy spare  parts for her tricycle such as tires, nuts and bolts, and fuel for the tricycle. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the tricycle. 

In the future, Angeline has hopes of making their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy spare  parts for tricycle like tires, nuts and bolts, and fuel for the tricycle

loans.name: Rey's Group

texts.en:
Rey is a 45-year-old widowed mother of five children, two schoolchildren and three paid workers, who lives in Battambang province, Cambodia. To support her family, she solely relies on one single business, chicken raising. This is the business that she has been with for three years. Rey is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), including this cycle. She is very much pleased with her past loans as they have improved her livelihood at a good pace.

 Now, Rey is leading a group consisting of four female members and the total requested loan amount is 4,700,000 KHR. Rey will use her loan portion in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR to buy more chickens to raise. She hopes to raise more chickens in healthy conditions and sell them at a high price to triple her income.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell at a profit

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
A local farmer on five hectares of farmland from Battambang province, Sreyoun is married and 29 years old. She has two children; both of them still rely on her as they are too young for school. The ten years of experience in her current business provides about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Sreyoun, a third time loan borrower, has utilized her past loan smartly to better support a good standard of living. 

Now, she is seeking 2,500,000 KHR to pay a plowing fee and to purchase potash. She hopes that she can earn more income and sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee for her farm.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción es una mujer de 47 años de edad casada y madre de 5 hijos los cuales juntos en familia se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria no completado el cual pudo cursar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio hasta el 5 grado y no pudo continuar por falta de ayuda económica ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos por lo cual las entradas de efectivo las distribuían realizando la compra de los alimentos para el sustento de su familia. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron el cultivo y siembra de café hace mas de 30 años y que hasta hoy en día sigue practicando dicha actividad la cual es el único medio de ingreso y sustento para su familia. El terreno que ellos cultiva lo adquirió el esposo por medio de una herencia familiar la cual les ha dado mucho fruto y esta ubicado a una distancia de 100 metros al cual se trasladan diariamente para darle mantenimiento y asistencia esto les permite mantener muy limpio sus cultivos. Su producto es comercializado y vendido por los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la comunidad para su adquisición.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante y abono para sus cultivo de café el cuales les permitirá mantener limpio de plagas y de enfermedades las cuales destruyen cultivos completos de no ser tratados a tiempo.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su cultivó para de esa manera generar mas ingresos que le permitan seguir invirtiendo en su producción de café ya que uno de los mas grandes desafíos es el constante aumento y el alza de los precios de los insumos mismos que son de gran ayuda para que la producción se pueda aprovechar en un 100% esto permitirá darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Concepción is a 47-year-old woman.  She's married and the mother of five children, who make a living growing coffee together as a family.  She didn't finish primary school, though she went through fifth grade with a lot of effort and sacrifice.  She lacked the financial help to continue because her parents had a low income level and had to use their cash input to buy food to support the family.

It was her parents who taught her how to grow coffee more than 30 years ago, which she continues doing up to the present.  It's the only income and means of support for her family.  Her husband acquired the land they cultivate from a family inheritance, and it has been fruitful for them.  The land is located 100 meters away, and they go there every day to maintain and weed it, which allows them to keep their crop free of weeds.  They sell their crop through various intermediaries who come to the community to acquire it.

Currently she's requesting help to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop so she can keep it free of pests and diseases that destroy entire crops if not treated in time.

Her dream is to expand her crop to generate more income so she can continue investing in coffee production.  One of her greatest challenges is the constant increase and rise in prices of the very supplies that are a big help in guaranteeing a 100% crop.  This will allow her to give her children a better education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop

loans.name: Flor Yaneth

texts.es:
Flor tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Su esposo es panificador y ella le ayuda a elaborar el pan francés, tienen 13 años de desempeñar esta labor. Fue su esposo quien le enseño; antes ella realizaba los oficios domésticos en la casa, trabajos agrícolas y a la crianza de pollos y gallinas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más cantidad de latas para hacer el pan y para pagar la reaparición del cilindro que lo tienen arreglando desde hace un mes. Esta herramienta es muy importante, ya que es la que ayuda a preparar la masa para elaborar el pan francés. Su propósito, es comprar un terreno para construir su casa y comprar una motocicleta más para expandir el negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is 34 years old, married, and has one child.  Her husband is a baker and she helps him to make French bread.  They have been in this line of work for 13 years.  It was Flor's husband who taught her the trade.  Before starting work in this business, Flor used to take care of the housework, carry out some farm work and raise hens and chickens.

Flor is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy more tins for making bread.  She will also pay for the return of the roller which has been in for repairs for the past month.  This tool is very important as it is used in preparing the dough for making the French bread.  Flor's goal is to buy a plot of land on which to build a house and to buy a motorcycle so that she can further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tins for making bread and to pay for the return of the roller which has been in for repairs for the past month

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods to the people in her place. Angelita is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, sodas, soap and toiletries, cooking materials, snack foods and others. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store. In the future, Angelita has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, sodas, soap and toiletries, cooking materials, snack foods and others

loans.name: Sokmara

texts.en:
Sokmara, 43, is a married mother of three children who are students in the local state school. She struggles to earn a living through working as a local school teacher in the area and does agricultural activities, vegetable growing and dragon-fruit planting. She has been engaged in the current business for 22 years, earning about 40,700 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Sokmara with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy more posts to grow more dragon fruit. She really hopes that she can grow her fruit so that it will be healthy and she will have more yield.

loans.use: To buy more posts to grow more dragon fruit

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 22 años de edad estado civil soltero vive con sus padres vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra y venta de naranjilla, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado.

Utilizara el dinero del crédito para la comprar  urea, fungicidas, semillas, abono para la naranjilla. Con el crédito que le otorga la cooperativa podrá aumentar la cantidad de la siembra. Sus compras las realiza en el cantón Guaranda. 

El sueño es llegar a tener mayor cantidad de productos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan es no poder comunicarse no tener medio de transporte y las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre se dedica a pasear.
"Esta muy agradecido por el anterior crédito.
texts.en:
Cesar is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Guaranda Canton in the Province of Bolívar. He is a member of the Nuevos Horizantes [New Horizons] Community Bank, which is located 40 minutes away in the community of Santa Martha, also in Guaranda Canton. 

Cesar works in agriculture, growing and selling naranjilla [a citrus-flavored fruit]. He also raises cattle. He will use this loan to buy urea, fungicide, seeds and fertilizer for his naranjilla crop. He says that with the loan he will be able to increase the size of his crop. He will buy his supplies in Guaranda Canton.

Cesar’s dream is to have a larger variety of products. The challenges he faces include isolation from neighboring areas, lack of transportation, and pests that harm his crops. In his free time he likes to take walks. He says he is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy urea, fungicide, seeds and fertilizer for his crop of naranjilla.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José  tiene   32 años de edad, está casado y vive con la  esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El  con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: José is 32 years old.  He is married and currently lives with his wife and two children.  With this loan, José intends to buy supplies such as fertiliser and insect sprays as well as using it to pay for labourers.  He wants to look after the plantation so the plants do not get damaged or produce a low yield.  That way his coffee-growing project will make higher profits that he will be able to use for his family.  José does not have enough to make these purchases on his own as he is poor and has no other way of finding the money that he needs.  So, he is applying for his first loan with "Fudecosur".  He has not had any other loans with state banks and "Fudecosur" is providing José with a loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and insect spray and to pay for labourers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 36-year-old business lady. She is married to Bernard and together they are blessed with two  children. She has been running a salon business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 12,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Gladys is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after she was introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to purchase hair chemicals, hair oils, weaves and hair extensions. With the anticipated profits from her salon, she will educate her children and start up a cosmetics shop. 


Her hopes and dreams are to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to purchase hair chemicals, hair oils, weaves and hair extensions

loans.name: Liova

texts.en:
Liova comes from the Akhalkalaki district. He is married and lives with his wife and 28-year-old son. Liova requested a loan from some local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Liova is a welder. He gets orders and produces different kinds of iron products such as iron doors and ovens. The income from this business is not stable, and it is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Liova requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Liova will cultivate a plot of agricultural land, and he will buy fertilizers and potato seeds. After the land is cultivated and fertilized, he will grow potatoes to sell. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To cultivate the land and purchase fertilizers and potato seeds

loans.name: Akuélé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d‘alimentation générale, madame Akuélé vit avec son conjoint  et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Ces derniers vont tous à l’école. Elle a démarré son activité en 1997 et fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son activité dans l’achat des produits alimentaires. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle espère agrandir la zone de service et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Elle est âgée de 45ans.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akuélé, age 45, is a reseller of general food products. She lives in Lomé with her spouse and their three children, who all go to school. She launched her activity in 1997, and she is seeking a first loan from WAGES to strengthen her business by stocking up on food products. 

In the long term, she plans to expand her business territory and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to stock up on general food products for resale.

loans.name: Tezalia

texts.es:
Tezalia, de 64 años de edad, esta casada con Hilario quien se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte, fruto de esa unión tiene 1 hija Lily de 30 años de edad. Juntos viven cómodamente en su propia casa en compañía de sus 2 nietos a los que quieren mucho.Tezalia se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros, al empezar con este negocio alquilaba su mototaxi pero viendo que se deterioraba rápidamente por el mal uso que le daban a su vehículo decidió que su esposo lo conduciría para realizar el servicio. Se inició hace 4 años cuando se compró su primer vehículo y en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando otras unidades mientras se deterioraban por el uso cotidiano que se le da.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar sus gastos familiares, empezó a desarrollar esta labor por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico ya que no podía conseguir un empleo estable, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad y que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona gastos que no planea, pero aun así logra obtener buenas ganancias. .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles y está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos y renovará el tapizado de su mototaxi para brindar mayor comodidad a los pasajeros .
texts.en:
64-year-old Tezalia is married to Hilario, who provides a transport service.  The couple have 1 daughter, Lily, who is 30 years old.  They live together in their own home together with their two grandchildren who they love very much.  Tezalia's business is providing a passenger transport service with a motorcycle taxi that she bought with her savings.  When she first started out in this business she hired a motorcycle taxi.  She saw that its condition was deteriorating rapidly owing to the hard conditions that it was being put through and decided that her husband could drive it in order to provide a service.  Four years ago, Tezalia bought her first vehicle and, over the years, she has also refurbished other vehicles as they deteriorate rapidly owing to the daily stresses that they are put through.

Tezalia enjoys her business as it makes her income with which she is able to cover her family's expenses.  She started working in her business because she needed an income and was unable to find a stable job.  She now feels more secure.  She doesn't like it when her motorcycle taxis experience problems very quickly as it creates unforeseen expenses.  However, she is still able to make good profits.

On this occasion, Tezalia is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles.  She is happy to know that she has financial support which allows her to make progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Tezalia will use the sum of money she has requested to buy spare parts and refurbish her motorcycle taxi's upholstery.  This will make her passengers' journeys more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi âgée de 39ans vit avec son conjoint et leurs 02 enfants scolarisés à Lomé. Pour prêter main forte à son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle revend des pagnes qu’elle expose sur étalage. Sa clientèle étant constituée de femmes, elle désire les garder c’est pour cela elle fait un second prêt à WAGES pour achat de pagnes. Elle désire servir un grand nombre de clientèle et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi, age 39, lives with her spouse and their two school-aged children in Lomé. To help her husband with the household expenses, she started selling pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) which she puts on display. 

To retain her clientele, which consists of women, she is seeking a second loan from WAGES to buy pagnes. She wants to increase her customer base and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Haydee De Jesús

texts.es:
Haydee tiene 46 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos. Ella realiza los oficios domésticos en su casa y a trabajar en el campo, en los cultivos de caña de azúcar y granos básicos. Esta labor la ha realizado desde hace unos 20 años, sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron. Actualmente, esta cortando caña de azúcar. Su esposo falleció y le ha tocado sacar adelante a sus hijos sola. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar plátanos, yuca, etc para preparar comida típica, debido a que ya no quiere seguir cortando caña; sino establecer su propio negocio en casa y estar mas cerca de sus hijos. Ella además, piensa cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de pipían, ya que es un fruto que tiene buen precio.
texts.en:
Haydee is a 46-year-old widow with two children.  She takes care of her housework and also works in the fields, looking after sugarcane crops and basic grains.  She has been in this line of work for 20 years, having learned from her parents.  She currently works cutting sugar cane.  Her husband died and she is now responsible for bringing up her children alone.

Haydee is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy plantains, cassava and other produce so that she can prepare traditional food.  She no longer wants to work cutting sugar cane but would rather set up her own home-based business so that she can be closer to her children.  In addition, she also plans to grown 7,000 square meters of pipían squash as this crop fetches a good price.

loans.use: to buy plantains, cassava, etc. for preparing traditional food to sell

loans.name: Decita

texts.en: Decita, a married woman from Talibon, Bohol who sells clothes and other fashion accessories, is requesting a loan to buy more to sell. This will enable Decita to cater to more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, she hopes to make her business a sustainable success.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothes and other accessories to sell.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is a fruit vendor particularly selling bananas. She buys them at a wholesale price and re-sells them at retail. She is 35 years old, married and has two children. Her spouse works abroad. The couple works hard to earn an income for the education of their children. 

Miraflor is now asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy more bananas to sell. It will add to her capital and allow her to develop her small business. 

Some day, with good sales and income, Miraflor will be able to save funds for education and future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ntepeko

texts.en:
Tepeko, now a father of four, has continued with his farming business, and successfully managed to pay off his loan. He used part of the proceeds to lease a bigger portion of land with the view to expanding his business.

He has been funded for his fourth loan of KES 50,000 which will help him prepare land for cultivation as well as acquire more seedlings for the extra piece of land. He plans to use the proceeds to pay school fees for his children and also build the family a permanent house.

His dream is to become a prominent commercial farmer and also improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: to cultivate his land and buy seedlings.

loans.name: Mbaapora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado MBAAPORA está en su ciclo 2 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, quieren mejorar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a sus familias. Quieren crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Maida es una de las miembros de este grupo, ella es comerciante, cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual surte a sus vecinos y personas de todos lugares. Maida cuenta que para empezar su negocio fue un poco difícil, pero que hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela y está creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, fideos, arroz, azúcar y otros para tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
The MBAAPORA group is in its second loan cycle of the women's committee programme. They are learning to work together and they want to improve their income to be able to help their families. They want to grow not only in the economic but also in the personal sense.

Maida is one of the members of this group. She's a trader and says she has a well-stocked grocery store, from which she supplies her neighbours and people from everywhere. 

Maida says that starting her business was quite hard, but now she has very good customers and is growing. She is applying for this loan to buy meat, noodles, rice, sugar and other things to stock her business well.

loans.use: to buy meat, noodles, rice, sugar and more.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi, a 36-year-old married woman, owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a grocery store, her customers her fellow residents. Seasonality and transportation of her goods are her main businesses challenges.

Mwanaharusi is requesting a loan of Kshs 50000 to buy more mangoes, oranges, nuts, etc. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation and access to loans.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, oranges, nuts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino Jr. is 37 years old, married with four children. All his four children go to school. Rufino Jr. is a hard-working and business-oriented man. He aims to improve his financial stability, have a comfortable lifestyle and let his four children finish their studies.

Rufino Jr. plans to buy boxes of fish sauce, five kilos of dried flying fish, five gallons of cooking oil, three kilos of dried squid and trays of eggs for his general store. In this situation, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. 

He knows that this loan amount will keep his general store profitable and progressive. He would be thankful enough if his requested loan amount is granted.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish sauce, five kilos of dried flying fish, five gallons of cooking oil, three kilos of dried squid and trays of eggs for his general store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old. She is married and they have been blessed with three kids of the following ages 14, 12 and nine. She runs a cereal shop and she has been in business for six years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 35,000.

She is borrowing KES 40,000 which she intend to use to purchase more stock of assorted cereals. This is her fourth loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of assorted cereals.

loans.name: Jorge Jr

texts.en:
Jorge is 34 years old, married and has three children. He grows hogs and butchers them too. He sells them at the public market. He has been in the business for over eight years now. He usually gains PHP 15,000 each month. It goes for meals, bills at home and education fees of his children. 

He wants to keep raising healthy hogs but has insufficient funds. That is why he is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy hogs, their feed and vaccines for sustainability. 

Some day, Jorge would like to keep making the business profitable in order to acquire more funds for education and the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy hogs, their feed and vaccines for sustainability.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda earns a living through her seaweed farming business in Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been engaged in the business together with her husband for more than three years now. This is their source of income. 

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, straw and to pay for the labor. With this, they will be able to improve their seaweed farming ventures as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, straw and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is 45 years old, separated and has been blessed with six children. She operates a stall wherein she offers rice, salt, cosmetic products and auto load max. Joselyn would like to buy an additional 50 cavans of rice but her income is not sufficient due to an abrupt increase of her household expenses and the daily allowances of her six children.

For this reason, Joselyn is seeking a loan of PHP 50,000. She hopes that her rice retailing business will continue to grow smoothly so she can earn greater income, improve her way of living and educate her six children.

Joselyn hopes and prays that her requested loan amount will be granted.

loans.use: to buy 50 cavans of rice for her stall.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia earns a living through her hog-raising business. She has been in involved in this business for more than three years now. This is her source of income. 

Florencia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. In the future, Florencia hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the repayment of her loan.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a thirty-five-year-old man, married to Beatrice and a father of three children. He is a charcoal dealer in Kangemi and has been in this business for three years now. He gets a monthly income of six thousand five hundred shillings.

This will be Robert's first loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to buy twenty sacks of charcoal to sell. In future he wants to open another shop in a different area.

loans.use: To buy twenty sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 27 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi with his 27-year-old wife Rusudan, parents and sister. Levan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is Levan’s monthly salary. He is working in a computer accessories shop. Levan repairs damaged computers which are sold in the shop. 

Levan requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Levan plans to open a computer shop. The family owns a commercial space, where they plan to sell and repair computers. With the received credit Levan will purchase show model products to put on the counter in their shop. As he is very experienced in this field and has many contacts in the warehouses, in case of orders he will purchase requested products at a low cost and sell them with the price markup. The expenses of the business will be reduced as they will not have to hire anybody or pay rent and also will be working on repair services. This business will increase the family income as and they will be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase show model computer products to put on the counter in their shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a single man. He describes himself to be a hardworking man. He operates a food retail business where he sells cakes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a heavy-traffic business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be having insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase a fridge and water dispenser. His business goal is to be a supplier of cakes  within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and water dispenser

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman, aged 37 years, and she has five school-going children. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water.  

She has a business of selling dry food at the market. With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she will buy more rice, dry maize, beans and other food items and accomplish her goal of opening a new kiosk.

loans.use: To buy more rice, dry maize, beans and other food items

loans.name: Rogelito

texts.en:
Rogelito is a business-oriented man. He offers various kinds of dental supplies to Region II and to some other parts of Visayas. He has been doing this kind of business for five years. He is thankful, because through his hard work and determination in life, he is able to earn a greater income.

Rogelito would like to take out a loan of PHP 50,000, allowing him to buy braces, fluoride, and ortho products for his dental supply business. He just hopes that his requested loan amount will be granted so that he can supply his customers. In this way, he could earn a greater profit, enabling him to pay for his household expenses, continue to make his dental supply business profitable, and to expand someday.

loans.use: To buy braces, fluoride, and ortho products for his dental supply business

loans.name: Doria

texts.es:
La  Sra. Doria es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 45 años, está casada con el Sr. Fermin de 44 años. Tienen 5 hijos, quienes ya son todos mayores e independientes.
Doria tiene una Casa Comercial  en su casa, tiene clientela formada, es una señora muy trabajadora, expelente cliente. Cuenta también que su esposo tiene una hamburguesería con lo que ellos se ayudan por salir adelante y con los que pudieron criar a sus hijos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar azúcar, fideos, harina, arroz y demás, y con esto tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Doria is from the city of Santaní. She is 45 years old and is married to Fermín, who is 44 years old. Together they have five children, who are all now adults and independent.

Doria has a store in her home with a well-established customer base. She is very hardworking and an excellent client of Fundación Paraguaya. Her husband has a hamburger bar, and the two of them help each other so that they can get ahead and so that they were able to raise their children. Doria is requesting this loan to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene  48 años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y tres hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and three children.  With this loan, she intends to purchase supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, and help with labor.  She plans to maintain her crops so that they do not suffer harm or lose productivity, and therefore generate more revenue from her coffee project to contribute to her family.  

Since she is of few resources, she does not have the necessary capital for the purchase or the labor contracts, and does not have the means to acquire the money needed.  For these reasons, she has requested this loan, the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  Prior to this, she had never had another loan from a national bank, but FUDECOSUR has given her loan with great ease and a very low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 40 años de edad, esta casada con Juan quien se dedica al transporte, vive con su pareja y sus dos  menores hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad respectivamente.Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de pescados frescos y plátanos, su negocio está instalado en el frontis de su hogar, ahí atiende desde muy temprano a sus clientes , desde hace 9 años realiza esta función sola y con mucho entusiasmo. Afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que diariamente logra vender todos los productos que ofrece a la venta y le gusta este trabajo porque le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad necesaria para su familia ,por tanto tiene muchas ganas de ampliar su negocio mejorando la infraestructura de su pequeño puesto, además quiere comprar un mototaxi para alquilarlo y generar asi más ganancias.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de pescado fresco tales como palometa y bagre ya que tienen mucha demanda en está temporada además está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married to Juan, who works in transportation. She lives with him and their two children, ages 14 and 9. Elizabeth sells fresh fish and plantains from a stall attached to the front of her home. She begins waiting on her customers very early in the morning. 

For nine years Elizabeth has worked at this business on her own and with a lot of enthusiasm. Fortunately, she says she does well because she manages to sell everything she offers for sale, and she likes the work because it gives her a source of income and the peace of mind her family needs. She is very eager to expand her business and improve the structure of her small stall. She also hopes to buy a motorcycle taxi, which she would like to rent out to generate more income. 

Elizabeth is requesting this loan of 1500 PEN to by fresh fish such as palometa [a silver freshwater fish] and catfish, both of which are in high demand at this time of year. She says she is happy to know she has financial support that will allow her to move ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish such as palometa and catfish.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis  tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, y vive con la esposa. El vive en la administración con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas doble prosito, para cría y leche. El quiere aumentar un poco la cantidad de animales, para tener más posibilidad de vender más crías. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis is 54 years old, is married, and lives with wife. He lives on the administration [possibly a building on an agricultural estate - more info needed] with his wife. He wants the loan to buy cows for two reasons - for breeding stock and for milk. He wants to increase the quantity of animals a little bit to give him the possibility of selling more offspring. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him an easier loan with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar semilla e insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea realizar un almacigo de café para su posterior siembra en una pequeña propiedad y para resembrar café perdido , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
William, an enterprising man, is 46 years old, married and currently lives with his wife and three children. He is applying for a loan with the hope of buying seed and supplies such as fertilizers and fumigants. He wants to make a coffee plot for his next sowing period on a small piece of land to re-sow lost coffee. 

The only limitation that this man has is a lack of money to continue growing considering that they depend on this business to carry on. For this reason he is applying for a loan. 

It's the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not registered for other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him an easier loan with much lower interest rates....

loans.use: with a coffee plot.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca, de 65 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 12 hijos,los cuales son mayores de edad e independientes. Vive en su casa casa de madera junto a uno de sus hijos, su nieto y su nuera.Blanca tiene una tienda de comestibles el cual esta instalado en su hogar y desde ahí atiende de manera amable y cordial a todos sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Ofrece a la venta diversos productos de primera necesidad como sal, arroz, pan, leche, huevos, verduras y otros , además los productos no perecibles los renueva semanalmente invirtiendo alrededor de 100 a 150 soles en cada compra. Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años y trabaja sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en su casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico,por esta razón tiene planeado ampliar su negocio  y además quiere adquirir un mototaxi para poder alquilarlo e incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de productos tales como sal, té , arroz , azucar , leche , entre otros para si seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes los productos necesarios para su hogar , además está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca, 65 years old, is a widowed mother of 12 children who are adult and independent.  She lives in her wooden house with one of her sons, her grandson and her daughter-in-law.  Blanca has a grocery store that is located in her house.  From there she serves all of her customers, who for the most part are her neighbors, in a friendly and cordial manner.  She has a variety of essential goods for sale such as salt, rice, bread, milk, eggs, vegetables and others.  Additionally, she replaces the non-perishable products on a weekly basis, investing about 100 to 150 soles in each purchase.  

She has had this business for over three years and works on her own.  She enjoys her business as it allows her to be at home and count on the peace of mind of an income.  For this reason, she plans on growing her business and wants to acquire a mototaxi in order to rent it and increase her earnings.  

She is requesting 1500 Soles in order to purchase products such as salt, tea, rice, sugar and milk among others so that she can continue to offer her clients the products they need for their homes.  She is pleased to know that she has the financial support to allow her to advance her business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as salt, rice and sugar among others.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria owns her grocery store wherein she offers rice and grocery items. She is married and has five children. Maria's husband works as a manufacturer of rice mills. The couple works hard in order to get ahead in life and improve their financial status.

Maria would like to increase the volume of grocery items and bags of rice she offers in her grocery store, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. She hopes to obtain this loan amount in order for her to satisfy her customer demand and have a comfortable living condition someday. 

Maria also hopes for continuous access of financial assistance so she can keep her grocery store progressive.

loans.use: to buy a volume of grocery items and bags of rice for her grocery store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina and her husband are engaged in mango fruit production. They live in Trinidad, Bohol together with their children. 

Marina is asking for a loan to buy pesticides and fruit enhancer chemicals for mango production. With this, they will be able to improve their business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fruit enhancer chemicals for mango production.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a 27 year old single man. He describes himself to be honest and trust worthy. He operates a general store where he sells cereals, sugar, soda, bread, cooking oil etc. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a viable profitable business environment. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure in the area leading to low bargaining power. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to to buy sugar, salt, soda, flour, and cooking fat. His business goal is to be a distributor within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a loan of Kes 10,000 successfully. In addition, Stanley does farming which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soda, flour, and cooking fat for resale

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Medalla Milagrosa está en su ciclo número 2  del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Repatriación distrito de Caaguazú, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. 
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, quien tiene su pequeña despensa, quiere que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de sus compañeras puedan ir mejorando sus vidas y las de sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos para su negocio, como ser fideos, azucares, panes, golosinas y articulos varios que son de primera necesidad para montar un pequeño almacén de consumo.
texts.en:
The Medalla Milagrosa [Miraculous Medal] Group is in its second loan cycle of the women’s committee program. It is located in the city of Repatriación, in the district of Caaguazú, which is a somewhat remote area that is still developing.

One of the members of the group is Maria, who has a small store. Her wish is for the members of the group to help each other, so that as time goes by, they can improve their and their families’ lives and find better futures. She is requesting this loan to buy products for her business, such as noodles, sugar, bread, candies and various other items that are necessary for setting up a small store.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, bread, candies and various other items for her store.

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Maendeleo is a group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District represented by Justine. The group has 8 women and 2 men. Justine is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Justine is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to the best input prices of hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Justine described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Justine’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal to sell

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary is a forty-nine year old widow and mother of five. She farms maize, cowpeas and green peas. Her major challenge with her farming is the pests that frequently destroy her crops, and without capital, she is unable to purchase pesticides. With the income from her KOMAZA trees she hopes to buy a dairy cow, some goats, install a water tank and start a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, some goats, install a water tank and start a grocery store

loans.name: Maduma Group

texts.en:
Ernest is a member of Maduma Group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 4 women and 6 men. Ernest is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Ernest joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Ernest joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Ernest described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Ernest’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela has earned a living through her food vending business for more than five years now.  She sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her area in Talibon, Bohol. Pamela works hard in order to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Pamela is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, margarine, and food flavorings. With these, she will be able to cook and sell more food, thus increasing her profit. Pamela believes that through this loan, her dreams of improving her family's way of living will be achieved.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, margarine, and food flavorings.

loans.name: Maduma Group

texts.en:
Jafred is a member of Maduma Group in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers: eight women and two men. Jafred is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for a half acre of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Jafred first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Jafred joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for his family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Jafred described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive a half-acre's agricultural inputs on credit. Jafred’s group will receive a total of five acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Francisco Octavio

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 53 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde muy pequeño sea dedicado al cultivo de maíz; fue un tío quien le enseño. Trabajaba junto a sus primos y su hermano, al pasar el tiempo se caso a su 30 años de edad y empezó a trabajar más fuerte para sus hijos y su esposa. Los insumos que necesita para cultivar, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a dos kilómetros de su casa; para trasportar los insumos paga para que los trasladen hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, pagar alquiler del terreno donde cultivara y preparar la tierra para sembrar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión, podrá sembrar más y obtener una mejor cosecha para incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindar el estudio universitario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 53 years old, married and has three children.  Taught by his uncle, he has been involved in the cultivation of corn since he was very little.  He worked alongside his cousins and brother, and after some time, he married at the age of 30 and began working harder for his children and wife.  

He purchases the supplies he needs to farm in a city located two kilometers from his house.  In order to transport the supplies, he pays for them to be delivered to his home.  The loan he has applied for from Fundacion Campo is to purchase agricultural supplies, pay the lease for the land he will grow on, and prepare the ground to plant 21,000 square meters of corn.  With this investment, he will be able to plant more and obtain a better harvest to increase his earnings and be able to pay his children's college tuition.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies, pay the lease on the land where he plans to grow, and prepare the ground to plant 21,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Jose
